org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.transport.http

Class HttpConstants.MessageProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.transport.http.HttpConstants.MessageProperties
  • Enclosing class:
    HttpConstants

    public static class HttpConstants.MessageProperties
extends java.lang.Object
    HTTP transport related message property keys

      • QUERY_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String QUERY_STRING
        The name of the message property that holds a String representation of URL query parameters. This query string will contain what came in the message and any alternations to the HttpConstants.MessageProperties.QUERY_PARAM_MAP wont be reflected in the QUERY_STRING, even though both refers to effectively the same value set initially. This property value; i.e. the query string MUST be treated as read-only and any changes to this string wont be effective for the message being sent out from the ESB after the mediation. For such alternation use the HttpConstants.MessageProperties.QUERY_PARAM_MAP property instead of the QUERY_STRING. The QUERY_STRING property value does not include the "?" prefix
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • METHOD

        public static final java.lang.String METHOD
        The name of the message property that holds the HTTP method
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MESSAGE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String MESSAGE_SIZE
        The name of the message property that holds the size of the received message over HTTP - This is only available for requests and responses received - and not for messages about to be sent out
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FORWARD_URL_POSTFIX

        public static final java.lang.String FORWARD_URL_POSTFIX
        The name of the message property that holds the URL postfix when a message gets forwarded. For example a request to /service/proxy/somepath/another?a=1&b=2 will result in a URL postfix of /somepath/another and a query parameter map of {a=1, b=2}. If this message is not sent over a 'prefix' endpoint address of http://realserver/anotherpath the absolute URL would be /anotherpath/somepath/another with the same query parameters
        See Also:
        BaseConstants.ADDRESS_URL_POSTFIX, Constant Field Values

      • PATH_PATTERN

        public static final java.lang.String PATH_PATTERN
        The path pattern transport property name to be used for the pattern configuration with placeholders in the HTTP path mainly used in the REST services. A sample path pattern will be /service/accountDetails/{customerId:(\d*)}/account/{accountId:(\d*)} where as the customerId and the accountId are the place holders, which can be accessed via the HTTPSupport.getFirstRequestParameter(org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.Message, String) method at the mediation
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUERY_PARAM_MAP_WDUPS

        public static final java.lang.String QUERY_PARAM_MAP_WDUPS
        The name of the message property that holds a Map> of URL query parameters (including duplicates. This Map can be changed during mediation, and the resulting values re-used if the message is forwarded
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUERY_PARAM_MAP

        public static final java.lang.String QUERY_PARAM_MAP
        Deprecated. since 2.0 The name of the message property that holds a Map of URL query parameters. This Map can be changed during mediation, and the resulting values re-used if the message is forwarded
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • URI_PATH_PARAM_MAP

        public static final java.lang.String URI_PATH_PARAM_MAP
        The mapped placeholders in the URI pattern as URI path parameters specified in the HttpConstants.MessageProperties.PATH_PATTERN transport property, these will be looked up by the HTTPSupport.getFirstRequestParameter(org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.Message, String) method for convenience from the HttpSupport provided that there is no query parameter with that exact place holder name
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
